author: Balbublock
title: Local support hub to assit devs
description: Local support is often necessary to train and support developers and community, address specific issues and create ambitious projects

assessments.note: The challenge tries to improve the experience for developers but the proposal tries to train more people on developing tools for Cardano. This is some different.

In general, the proposal address the challenge, but not as well as the challenge of Local Community Centers. The plan presented is very vague, which makes it difficult to assess the impact of the proposal on the challenge. The problem statement and the solution are reasonable, but the proposal doesn't address the risks that the Covid-19 pandemic may have in the project, many locations in the world are with movement restrictions and even in places where there are no movement restrictions some people prefer to isolate themselves or do home office.

This proposal aims to be a support group.
This has been filed in the wrong challenge. It should be listed under 'Local Community Centers'.
I'm not sure local support hub would help develop cardano eco-system, a general online hub would touch even more people.
Although local support is valuable in furthering developer adoption and success, the proposal does not provide details regarding type of support, training, the Cardano languages involved, etc.

This proposal lacks specifics, and may be in the wrong section. If you are wanting to create a local hub, consider putting this proposal in the Local Community Center, and please being more specific about exactly where this hub will be. You mentioned that you are located in France but failed to specify what city or locality.

It is not stated, how they plan to establish themselves as local support hub and not details on the kind of training is provided. A group of experienced developer sound good, and the linked webpage makes also a professional impression.

The plan presented has not enough details. What will the training and support for developers look like? How many devs can be trained? Which programming languages will be taught? These are examples of questions that should be clear.

The proposal mentions a team of 14 developers and researchers. Who will actively participate in the proposal? What are their professional experiences and skills? There is mention of development experience in the Ethereum and Tezos blockchains, but nothing was mentioned about Cardano. Will the hub intend to support Cardano or multiple blockchains?

The proposal exists out of an extensive team with relevant experience to provide support.
The list of partners is impressive, but it leaves me questioning why all those universities would have a need for an external support group.
The team look skilled enough to support developper in their project, but the plan and criteria to find developper seems unclear to me

It appears that the proposers' experience is with blockchains other than Cardano. The proposal does not concretely specify the nature of the support hubs (in person, virtual, one-on-one, team-based, etc.). The KPIs are admirable and relevant, but not quantified in the proposal.

Until a more specific plan is proposed, and possibly, put this proposal in the Local Community Center Campaign. Currently, it is highly unlikely this proposal will be implemented successfully until a more thoughtful plan of execution is proposed to achieve the three goals as listed.

As I stated before, I think the proposal misses the topic and therefore can be an effective way to address it. I added one star, because the suggested service might still benefit Cardano as a Project.

There is little information to assess the feasibility of the proposal. There is no roadmap, milestones, KPIs, budget allocation details and the plan itself lacks important details for us to understand the impact of the proposal on the challenge.

The solution to the problem is still too vague. What I can make out of it is that you would function as liaisons. Is that correct?
A roadmap on how you would create these centers of expertise would provide a useful insight in this.
I have noticed that you have filed 2 proposals that are almost exactly the same, just paraphrased. Could you elaborate?

I think the plan don't have enough details so the global project is unclear, we don't really know how the budget will be allocated. the proposer should rework their proposal to clarify how those hub would work, and how they would bring their project to success
The proposal does not provide sufficient information to assess the appropriateness of the proposed budget. It does not provide information on the scope of the "experiments".

solution: We propose to be one of the first support hubs, to gather best practices and bring concrete projects and several developers on Cardano
experience: We are 14 people (developer - researcher) working on many projects in the French ecosystem on different Blockchain (Ethereum & Tezos)
